Allow me to reintroduce myself…

Since I’ve revamped my site, I figured it would be a good idea to provide a bit more detail on who I am and what my story is (so far). Especially since right now the site is more focused on blogging than being my online portfolio.

Just the highlights

Hi, I’m Jordan! After being miserable with my life, I recently made a huge leap of faith, quit my old job, sold all of my belongings and moved to Austin Texas. I realized I needed focus on what would make me happy instead of worrying about other peoples expectations of me. So here I am, reinventing myself and enjoying life again. This blog is going to be my attempt at documenting my transition as well as an avenue to explore three of my favorite topics: software engineering, personal finance and philsophy/psychology. Please tag along with me and reach out/connect with me if anything resonates with you.

item.content:encoded:
Using Gatsby.js is Easy and Powerful

So, after running through most of the tutorial on gatsby, I wanted to do a quick write up on my overall impressions.

I haven’t played around with too many other static site generators, but I have really enjoyed the developer experience gatsby provides. I have wanted to work with both React and GraphQL and this gave me the perfect use case.

Getting started was incredibly easy as well. I built a new project with one of their simple starters and had it up and running on my GitHub page with ease. It took me a little bit of time playing around with different components to get the basic look and content the way I wanted, but deploying it was a breeze with the gh-pages plugin.

As I customize and build out new parts of my site, I plan on writing up the process and how I did it. But for now, I wanted to throw up some quick impressions.

item.content:encoded:
We’re BAAAAAACK!!!!

Well, I spent most of this weekend messing around with gatsby.js to build up this new blog/website. I finally got most of it sorted out and got this barebones blog up and running.

Over the next few weeks I plan on building out a few more pages focused on who I am, what I do and showing some examples of my work. Kind of like an online resume. During all of this, I will do a more detailed write up of my experience working with gatsby.js.

After that, I plan on posting more blog items focused on philosophy and personal finances.

Thanks for hanging around with me!
